newsitem.title: USA: S.D. 420 MW Big Stone coal-fired plant shuts Thurs.
newsitem.headline: S.D. 420 MW Big Stone coal-fired plant shuts Thurs.

text.p: A 420 megawatt (MW) coal-fired generating station in Big Stone City, S.D., was shut Thursday as engineers began investigating a problem at the plant's fire system, the operator Otter Tail Power Co said today.
"We're not sure of the cause," a company spokesman said, adding the manufacturer of the system was contacted.
The utility anticipated the outage at the Big Stone facility would be brief, the spokesman said.
"We expect it's a matter of days," he said, adding there was ample generation capacity to meet current demand.
Otter Tail Power, based in Fergus Falls, Minn., also has majority ownership of Big Stone. Northwestern Public Service and Montana-Dakota Utilities are the other owners of the plant.
